original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: khams mang po pa'i mdo /
analyzed: khams mang po pa'i mdo /

original: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to youthful Mañjuśrī.

original: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa dus gcig na /
analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa dus gcig na /
translated: Thus have I heard at one time.

original: bcom ldan 'das @552a *//
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das @552a *//
translated: The Blessed One

original: mnyan du yod pa na rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: mnyan du yod pa na rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: was dwelling in Śrāvastī, in the Jeta Grove, in the park of Anāthapiṇḍada.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo gcig pu /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo gcig pu /
translated: Then the venerable Ānanda,

original: dben par song ste nang du yang dag bzhag nas sems la sems kyi rnam par rtog pa 'di lta bu dag skyes te /
analyzed: dben par song ste nang du yang dag bzhag nas sems la sems kyi rnam par rtog pa 'di lta bu dag skyes te /
translated: having gone alone to a secluded place and sat down for meditation, had the following thought:

original: 'jigs pa gang dag 'byung zhing skye ba de dag thams cad ni /
analyzed: 'jigs pa gang dag 'byung zhing skye ba de dag thams cad ni /
translated: All fears and terrors that arise

original: byis pa las skye'i /🔽mkhas pa las ni /
analyzed: byis pa las skye'i / mkhas pa las ni /
translated: arise from the childish,

original: ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin no //
translated: not from the wise.

original: yams kyi nad gang dag dang / gnod pa dang / nad 'go ba dang / 'khrug pa gang dag 'byung zhing skye ba de dag thams cad ni; byis pa las skye'i /🔽mkhas pa las ni /
analyzed: yams kyi nad gang dag dang / gnod pa dang / nad 'go ba dang / 'khrug pa gang dag 'byung zhing skye ba de dag thams cad ni; byis pa las skye'i / mkhas pa las ni /
translated: All these calamities, misfortunes, epidemics, and conflicts that arise and occur arise from the childish,

original: ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin no //
translated: not from the wise.🔽”

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo /
translated: Then the venerable Ānanda

original: phyem red nang du yang dag 'jog las langs nas bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ste phyin nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal te phyogs gcig tu 'dug go /
analyzed: phyem red nang du yang dag 'jog las langs nas bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ste phyin nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal te phyogs gcig tu 'dug go /
translated: rose from his seclusion in the late afternoon, went to the Blessed One, and after bowing his head at the Blessed One’s feet, sat down to one side.

original: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: After he had sat down to one side, the venerable Ānanda said to the Blessed One,

original: btsun pa / 'dir bdag gcig pu dben par mchis te nang du yang dag bzhag na sems la sems kyi rnam par rtog pa 'di lta bu dag skyes te; 'jigs pa gang dag 'byung zhing skye ba de dag thams cad ni /
analyzed: btsun pa / 'dir bdag gcig pu dben par mchis te nang du yang dag bzhag na sems la sems kyi rnam par rtog pa 'di lta bu dag skyes te; 'jigs pa gang dag 'byung zhing skye ba de dag thams cad ni /
translated: “Lord, when I was alone in seclusion, a thought arose in my mind: ‘All these fears that arise and occur arise from the childish,

original: byis ba las skye'i /
analyzed: byis ba las skye'i /
translated: not from the wise.’

original: mkhas pa las ni /
analyzed: mkhas pa las ni /

analyzed: ma lags so // yams kyi nad gang dag dang / gnod pa dang / @552b nad 'go ba dang / 'khrug pa gang dag 'byung zhing skye ba de dag thams cad ni /

analyzed: byis pa las skye'i / mkhas pa las ni /
translated: “Ānanda, all the calamities, misfortunes, diseases, conflicts, and disturbances that arise and occur arise from the childish.

analyzed: ma lags so snyam mo //
translated: They do not arise from the wise.”

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /

analyzed: yang dag par blang bar bya ste /

analyzed: kun dga' bo /

analyzed: de ltar de bzhin du bslab par bya'o //

translated: Lord, to what extent do childish beings belong to the category of the childish?”

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: “Ānanda,

original: byis pa ni /
analyzed: byis pa ni /
translated: the childish

original: khams la mkhas pa ma yin pa dang / skye mched la mkhas pa ma yin pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mkhas pa ma yin pa dang / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la mkhas pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: khams la mkhas pa ma yin pa dang / skye mched la mkhas pa ma yin pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mkhas pa ma yin pa dang / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la mkhas pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: He is not skilled in the elements, he is not skilled in the sense bases, he is not skilled in dependent origination, and he is not skilled in what is possible and impossible.

original: kun dga' bo //
analyzed: kun dga' bo //
translated: Ānanda,

original: de tsam gyis na byis pa byis pa zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro ba yin no //
analyzed: de tsam gyis na byis pa byis pa zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro ba yin no //
translated: to that extent one is counted as a fool.

original: btsun pa / ji tsam gyis na mkhas pa mkhas pa zhes bgyi ba'i grangs su mchi ba lags /
analyzed: btsun pa / ji tsam gyis na mkhas pa mkhas pa zhes bgyi ba'i grangs su mchi ba lags /
translated: “Lord, to what extent is one counted as wise?”

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: “Ānanda,

original: mkhas pa ni /
analyzed: mkhas pa ni /
translated: a wise person

original: khams la mkhas pa dang / skye mched la mkhas pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mkhas pa dang / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la mkhas pa yin te /
analyzed: khams la mkhas pa dang / skye mched la mkhas pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mkhas pa dang / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la mkhas pa yin te /
translated: is skilled in the elements, skilled in the sense bases, skilled in dependent origination, and skilled in what is possible and impossible.

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

original: de tsam gyis na mkhas pa mkhas pa zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro ba yin no //
analyzed: de tsam gyis na mkhas pa mkhas pa zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro ba yin no //
translated: to that extent one is counted as wise.”

original: btsun pa / ji tsam gyis na mkhas pa khams la mkhas pa lags /
analyzed: btsun pa / ji tsam gyis na mkhas pa khams la mkhas pa lags /
translated: “Lord, to what extent is a wise person skilled in the elements?”

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: “Ānanda,

original: mkhas pa ni /
analyzed: mkhas pa ni /
translated: The wise

original: khams bco brgyad po mig gi khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / rna ba'i khams dang / sgra'i khams dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / sna'i khams dang / dri'i khams dang /
analyzed: khams bco brgyad po mig gi khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / rna ba'i khams dang / sgra'i khams dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / sna'i khams dang / dri'i khams dang /
translated: know and see the eighteen elements just as they are: the eye element, the form element, the eye consciousness element, the ear element, the sound element,🔽the ear consciousness element, the nose element, the smell element,🔽the nose consciousness element, the tongue element, the taste element,🔽the tongue consciousness element, the body element, the tangible element,

original: sna'i @554a *// rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / lce'i khams dang / ro'i khams dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / lus kyi khams dang / reg bya'i khams dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / yid kyi khams dang /
analyzed: sna'i @554a *// rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / lce'i khams dang / ro'i khams dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / lus kyi khams dang / reg bya'i khams dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / yid kyi khams dang /
translated: the body consciousness element, the mind element,

original: chos kyi khams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes shing mthong ba ste /
analyzed: chos kyi khams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes shing mthong ba ste /
translated: the phenomena element, and the mind consciousness element.

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

original: de ltar na khams bco brgyad po yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes shing mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na khams bco brgyad po yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes shing mthong ba yin no //
translated: in this way the eighteen elements are known and seen just as they are.

original: gzhan yang khams drug po sa'i khams dang; chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes shing mthong ba ste; de ltar na khams drug po yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes shing mthong ba yin no //🔽gzhan yang khams drug po 'dod pa'i khams dang / gnod sems kyi khams dang / rnam par 'tshe ba'i khams dang / nges par 'byung ba'i khams dang / gnod sems med pa'i khams dang / rnam par 'tshe ba med pa'i khams dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes shing mthong ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang khams drug po sa'i khams dang; chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes shing mthong ba ste; de ltar na khams drug po yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes shing mthong ba yin no // gzhan yang khams drug po 'dod pa'i khams dang / gnod sems kyi khams dang / rnam par 'tshe ba'i khams dang / nges par 'byung ba'i khams dang / gnod sems med pa'i khams dang / rnam par 'tshe ba med pa'i khams dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes shing mthong ba ste /
translated: Furthermore, the six elements—the earth element, the water element, the fire element, the wind element, the space element, and the consciousness element—are known and seen just as they are. Thus, the six elements are known and seen just as they are.🔽Furthermore, the six elements—the element of desire, the element of malice, the element of harmfulness, the element of renunciation, the element of non-malice, and the element of non-harmfulness—are known and seen just as they are.

original: de ltar na khams drug po yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes shing mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na khams drug po yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes shing mthong ba yin no //
translated: Thus, the six elements are known and seen just as they are.

original: gzhan yang khams drug po bde ba'i khams dang / sdug bsngal gyi @554b khams dang / yid bde ba'i khams dang / yid mi bde ba'i khams dang / btang snyoms kyi khams dang / ma rig pa'i khams dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes shing mthong ba ste //
analyzed: gzhan yang khams drug po bde ba'i khams dang / sdug bsngal gyi @554b khams dang / yid bde ba'i khams dang / yid mi bde ba'i khams dang / btang snyoms kyi khams dang / ma rig pa'i khams dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes shing mthong ba ste //
translated: Furthermore, one sees and knows the six elements as they are: the element of pleasure, the element of pain, the element of mental pleasure, the element of mental displeasure, the element of equanimity, and the element of ignorance.

original: de ltar na khams drug po yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes shing mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na khams drug po yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes shing mthong ba yin no //
translated: In this way, one sees and knows the six elements as they are.

original: gzhan yang khams bzhi po tshor ba'i khams dang / 'du shes kyi khams dang / 'du byed kyi khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes shing mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang khams bzhi po tshor ba'i khams dang / 'du shes kyi khams dang / 'du byed kyi khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes shing mthong ba yin no //
translated: Furthermore, one sees and knows the four elements as they are: the element of feeling, the element of perception, the element of volitional formations, and the element of consciousness.

original: gzhan yang khams gsum po 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes shing mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang khams gsum po 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes shing mthong ba yin no //
translated: Furthermore, one sees and knows the three elements as they are: the element of desire, the element of form, and the formless element.

original: gzhan yang khams gsum po gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams dang / 'gog pa'i khams dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes shing mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang khams gsum po gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams dang / 'gog pa'i khams dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes shing mthong ba yin no //
translated: Moreover, the three realms—the realm of form, the formless realm, and the realm of cessation—are known and seen just as they are.

original: gzhan yang khams gsum po 'das pa'i khams dang / ma 'ongs pa'i khams dang / da ltar byung ba'i khams dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes shing mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang khams gsum po 'das pa'i khams dang / ma 'ongs pa'i khams dang / da ltar byung ba'i khams dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes shing mthong ba yin no //
translated: Moreover, the three realms—the past realm, the future realm, and the present realm—are known and seen just as they are.

original: gzhan yang khams gsum po dman pa'i khams dang / bar ma'i khams dang / gya nom pa'i khams dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes shing mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang khams gsum po dman pa'i khams dang / bar ma'i khams dang / gya nom pa'i khams dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes shing mthong ba yin no //
translated: Moreover, the three realms—the inferior realm, the middling realm, and the superior realm—are known and seen just as they are.

original: gzhan yang khams gsum po dge ba'i khams dang / mi dge ba'i khams dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i khams dag yang dag pa ji lta @555a *//🔽ba bzhin shes shing mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang khams gsum po dge ba'i khams dang / mi dge ba'i khams dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i khams dag yang dag pa ji lta @555a *//🔽ba bzhin shes shing mthong ba yin no //
translated: Moreover, the three realms—the wholesome realm, the unwholesome realm, and the indeterminate realm—are known and seen just as they are.

original: gzhan yang khams gsum po slob pa'i khams dang / mi slob pa'i khams dang / slob pa'ang ma yin mi slob pa'ang ma yin pa'i khams dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes shing mthong ba yin no //🔽gzhan yang khams gnyis po zag pa dang bcas pa'i khams dang / zag pa med pa'i khams dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes shing mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang khams gsum po slob pa'i khams dang / mi slob pa'i khams dang / slob pa'ang ma yin mi slob pa'ang ma yin pa'i khams dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes shing mthong ba yin no // gzhan yang khams gnyis po zag pa dang bcas pa'i khams dang / zag pa med pa'i khams dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes shing mthong ba yin no //
translated: Moreover, they know and see correctly the three realms: the realm of training, the realm of no more training, and the realm that is neither training nor no more training.🔽Moreover, they know and see correctly the two realms: the realm with contaminants and the realm without contaminants.

original: gzhan yang khams gnyis po 'dus byas kyi khams dang / 'dus ma byas kyi khams dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes shing mthong ba yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang khams gnyis po 'dus byas kyi khams dang / 'dus ma byas kyi khams dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes shing mthong ba yin te /
translated: Moreover, they know and see correctly the two realms: the conditioned realm and the unconditioned realm.

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

original: de tsam gyis na mkhas pa khams la mkhas pa yin no //
analyzed: de tsam gyis na mkhas pa khams la mkhas pa yin no //
translated: to that extent the wise are skilled in the elements.

original: btsun pa / ji tsam gyis na mkhas pa skye mched la mkhas pa lags /
analyzed: btsun pa / ji tsam gyis na mkhas pa skye mched la mkhas pa lags /
translated: Venerable One, to what extent are the wise skilled in the sense bases?

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

original: mkhas pa ni /
analyzed: mkhas pa ni /
translated: the wise

original: skye mched bcu gnyis po mig gi skye mched dang / gzugs kyi skye mched dang / rna ba'i skye mched dang / sgra'i skye mched dang / sna'i skye mched dang / dri'i skye mched dang / lce'i skye mched dang / ro'i skye mched dang / lus kyi skye mched dang /
analyzed: skye mched bcu gnyis po mig gi skye mched dang / gzugs kyi skye mched dang / rna ba'i skye mched dang / sgra'i skye mched dang / sna'i skye mched dang / dri'i skye mched dang / lce'i skye mched dang / ro'i skye mched dang / lus kyi skye mched dang /
translated: The twelve sense sources are the eye sense source, the form sense source, the ear sense source, the sound sense source, the nose sense source, the smell sense source, the tongue sense source, the taste sense source, the body sense source,

original: reg bya'i skye mched dang / yid kyi skye mched dang / chos kyi skye mched dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes shing mthong ba ste /
analyzed: reg bya'i skye mched dang / yid kyi skye mched dang / chos kyi skye mched dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes shing mthong ba ste /
translated: the tactile sense source, the mind sense source, and the dharma sense source.

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

original: de tsam gyis na /
analyzed: de tsam gyis na /
translated: to that extent

original: mkhas pa skye mched la mkhas pa yin no //
analyzed: mkhas pa skye mched la mkhas pa yin no //
translated: the learned are skilled in the sense sources.”

original: btsun pa / ji tsam gyis na @555b mkhas pa rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la mkhas pa lags /
analyzed: btsun pa / ji tsam gyis na @555b mkhas pa rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la mkhas pa lags /
translated: “Lord, to what extent are the learned skilled in dependent origination?”

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: “Ānanda,

original: mkhas pa ni /
analyzed: mkhas pa ni /
translated: the learned

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba 'di nyid lugs bzhin 'byung ba dang / lugs las ldog pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba 'di nyid lugs bzhin 'byung ba dang / lugs las ldog pa 'di lta ste /
translated: are skilled in the forward and reverse processes of dependent origination, which are as follows:

original: 'di yod pas 'di 'byung /
analyzed: 'di yod pas 'di 'byung /
translated: ‘When this exists, that comes to be.’

original: 'di skyes pas 'di skye ste /
analyzed: 'di skyes pas 'di skye ste /
translated: When this arises, that arises.

original: 'di ltar ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed /
analyzed: 'di ltar ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed /
translated: Thus, with ignorance as condition, there are volitions;

original: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa /
translated: with volitions as condition, there is consciousness;

original: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs /
translated: with consciousness as condition, name and form;

original: ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis skye mched drug /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis skye mched drug /
translated: with name and form as condition, the six sense spheres;

original: skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis reg pa /🔽reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba /
analyzed: skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis reg pa / reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba /
translated: with the six sense spheres as condition, contact;🔽with contact as condition, feeling;

original: tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa /
analyzed: tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa /
translated: with feeling as condition, craving;

original: sred pa'i rkyen gyis len pa /
analyzed: sred pa'i rkyen gyis len pa /
translated: with craving as condition, grasping;

original: len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa /
analyzed: len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa /
translated: with grasping as condition, existence;

original: srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba /
analyzed: srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba /
translated: with existence as condition, birth;

original: skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa dag 'byung zhing sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'ba' zhig 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa dag 'byung zhing sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'ba' zhig 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: with birth as condition, aging, death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, dejection, and anguish all arise. Thus, there is the arising of this whole great mass of suffering.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: 'di med pas 'di mi 'byung /
analyzed: 'di med pas 'di mi 'byung /
translated: When this does not exist, that does not exist.

original: 'di 'gags pas 'di 'gag ste /
analyzed: 'di 'gags pas 'di 'gag ste /
translated: When this ceases, that ceases.

original: 'di ltar ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed 'gag /
analyzed: 'di ltar ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed 'gag /
translated: Thus, through the cessation of ignorance, formations cease.

original: 'du byed 'gags pas rnam par shes pa 'gag /
analyzed: 'du byed 'gags pas rnam par shes pa 'gag /
translated: Through the cessation of formations, consciousness ceases.

original: rnam par shes pa 'gags pas ming dang gzugs 'gag /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'gags pas ming dang gzugs 'gag /
translated: Through the cessation of consciousness, name and form cease.

original: ming dang gzugs 'gags pas skye mched drug 'gag /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs 'gags pas skye mched drug 'gag /
translated: Through the cessation of name and form, the six sense sources cease.

original: skye mched drug 'gags pas reg pa 'gag /
analyzed: skye mched drug 'gags pas reg pa 'gag /
translated: Through the cessation of the six sense sources, contact ceases.

original: reg pa 'gags pas tshor ba 'gag /
analyzed: reg pa 'gags pas tshor ba 'gag /
translated: Through the cessation of contact, feeling ceases.

original: tshor ba 'gags pas sred pa @556a *//🔽'gag / sred pa 'gags pas len pa 'gag /
analyzed: tshor ba 'gags pas sred pa @556a *// 'gag / sred pa 'gags pas len pa 'gag /
translated: Through the cessation of feeling, craving ceases.🔽Through the cessation of craving, grasping ceases.

original: len pa 'gags pas srid pa 'gag /
analyzed: len pa 'gags pas srid pa 'gag /
translated: Through the cessation of grasping, becoming ceases.

original: srid pa 'gags pas skye ba 'gag /
analyzed: srid pa 'gags pas skye ba 'gag /
translated: Through the cessation of becoming, birth ceases.

original: skye ba 'gags pas rga shi dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa dag 'gag cing sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'di 'ba' zhig 'gag par 'gyur ba dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes shing mthong ba yin te /
analyzed: skye ba 'gags pas rga shi dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa dag 'gag cing sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'di 'ba' zhig 'gag par 'gyur ba dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes shing mthong ba yin te /
translated: Through the cessation of birth, old age, death, sorrow, lamentation, suffering, unhappiness, and strife cease. Thus, this great mass of nothing but suffering ceases.

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ananda,

original: de tsam gyis na mkhas pa rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la mkhas pa yin no //
analyzed: de tsam gyis na mkhas pa rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la mkhas pa yin no //
translated: In this way, the wise are skilled in dependent origination.

original: btsun pa / ji tsam gyis na mkhas pa gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la mkhas pa lags /
analyzed: btsun pa / ji tsam gyis na mkhas pa gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la mkhas pa lags /
translated: “Reverend Lord, how is it that the wise are skilled in what is possible and what is impossible?”

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: “Ānanda,

original: mkhas pa ni /
analyzed: mkhas pa ni /
translated: the wise

original: gnas la gnas dang / gnas ma yin pa la gnas ma yin pa dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes shing mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: gnas la gnas dang / gnas ma yin pa la gnas ma yin pa dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes shing mthong ba yin no //
translated: perceive and see correctly what is possible and what is impossible.

original: kun dga' bo /🔽'di ni / gnas ma yin zhing go skabs med pa ste /
analyzed: kun dga' bo / 'di ni / gnas ma yin zhing go skabs med pa ste /
translated: “Ānanda,

original: gang lus kyis nyes par spyad pa dang / ngag dang yid kyis nyes par spyad pa'i rnam par smin pa 'dod pa dang / sdug pa dang / dga' ba dang / yid du 'ong ba dag mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba 'di ni /🔽gnas ma yin no; ;'di ni /
analyzed: gang lus kyis nyes par spyad pa dang / ngag dang yid kyis nyes par spyad pa'i rnam par smin pa 'dod pa dang / sdug pa dang / dga' ba dang / yid du 'ong ba dag mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba 'di ni / gnas ma yin no; ;'di ni /
translated: it is impossible and there is no chance that the ripening of the misdeeds of body, speech, and mind will be desirable, attractive, and delightful.🔽This is impossible.

original: gnas yin te /
analyzed: gnas yin te /
translated: This is possible:

original: gang lus kyis nyes par spyad pa dang / ngag dang yid kyis nyes par spyad pa'i rnam par smin pa 'dod pa ma yin pa dang / sdug pa ma yin pa @556b dang / dga' ba ma yin pa dang / yid du 'ong ba ma yin pa dag mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba 'di ni /
analyzed: gang lus kyis nyes par spyad pa dang / ngag dang yid kyis nyes par spyad pa'i rnam par smin pa 'dod pa ma yin pa dang / sdug pa ma yin pa @556b dang / dga' ba ma yin pa dang / yid du 'ong ba ma yin pa dag mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba 'di ni /
translated: This is possible:🔽that the ripening of physical misconduct,🔽verbal misconduct, and mental misconduct will be undesirable,

original: gnas yin no //
analyzed: gnas yin no //
translated: unappealing, unpleasant, and disagreeable.

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: “Ānanda,🔽this is impossible and cannot happen:🔽that the ripening of physical good conduct,

original: 'di ni / gnas ma yin zhing go skabs med pa ste; gang lus kyis legs par spyad pa dang / ngag dang yid kyis legs par spyad pa'i rnam par smin pa 'dod pa ma yin pa dang / sdug pa ma yin pa dang / dga' ba ma yin pa dang /🔽yid du 'ong ba ma yin pa dag mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba 'di ni /
analyzed: 'di ni / gnas ma yin zhing go skabs med pa ste; gang lus kyis legs par spyad pa dang / ngag dang yid kyis legs par spyad pa'i rnam par smin pa 'dod pa ma yin pa dang / sdug pa ma yin pa dang / dga' ba ma yin pa dang / yid du 'ong ba ma yin pa dag mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba 'di ni /
translated: verbal good conduct, and mental good conduct will be undesirable,

original: gnas ma yin no //
analyzed: gnas ma yin no //
translated: unappealing, unpleasant, and disagreeable.

original: 'di ni / gnas yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni / gnas yin te /
translated: “This is possible:

original: gang lus kyis legs par spyad pa dang / ngag dang yid kyis legs par spyad pa'i rnam par smin pa 'dod pa dang / sdug pa dang / dga' ba dang / yid du 'ong ba dag mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba 'di ni /
analyzed: gang lus kyis legs par spyad pa dang / ngag dang yid kyis legs par spyad pa'i rnam par smin pa 'dod pa dang / sdug pa dang / dga' ba dang / yid du 'ong ba dag mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba 'di ni /
translated: It is possible that the results of good physical, verbal, and mental actions will be desirable, attractive, delightful, and pleasant.

original: gnas yin no //
analyzed: gnas yin no //
translated: This is possible.

original: gnas ma yin zhing go skabs med pa ni /🔽gang lus kyis nyes par spyad pa spyad /
analyzed: gnas ma yin zhing go skabs med pa ni / gang lus kyis nyes par spyad pa spyad /
translated: It is impossible and there is no opportunity for

translated: the results of bad physical, verbal, and mental actions to be desirable, attractive, delightful, and pleasant.

original: gnas ma yin no //
analyzed: gnas ma yin no //
translated: This is impossible.🔽It is possible that the results of bad physical, verbal, and mental actions will be undesirable, unattractive, not delightful, and unpleasant.

original: 'di ni / gnas yin te /🔽gang lus kyis nyes par spyad pa spyad /
analyzed: 'di ni / gnas yin te /🔽gang lus kyis nyes par spyad pa spyad /
translated: This is possible.

original: ngag dang yid kyis nyes par spyad pa spyad nas rgyu de dang rkyen des lus zhig nas shi phan chad ngan song ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba dag gi nang du skye bar 'gyur ba 'di ni /
analyzed: ngag dang yid kyis nyes par spyad pa spyad nas rgyu de dang rkyen des lus zhig nas shi phan chad ngan song ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba dag gi nang du skye bar 'gyur ba 'di ni /
translated: Having engaged in verbal and mental misdeeds, due to that cause and condition, after the body’s destruction, death, and the end of life, one will be born among the hell beings, in the lower realms, in the evil destinies.

original: gnas yin no //
analyzed: gnas yin no //
translated: This is possible.

original: gnas ma yin zhing go skabs med pa ni /🔽gang lus kyis legs @557a *//
analyzed: gnas ma yin zhing go skabs med pa ni / gang lus kyis legs @557a *//
translated: It is impossible and there is no chance that

original: par spyad pa spyad /
analyzed: par spyad pa spyad /
translated: having engaged in physical good conduct,

original: ngag dang yid kyis legs par spyad pa spyad nas rgyu de dang rkyen des lus zhig nas shi phan chad ngan song ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba dag gi nang du skye bar 'gyur ba 'di ni /
analyzed: ngag dang yid kyis legs par spyad pa spyad nas rgyu de dang rkyen des lus zhig nas shi phan chad ngan song ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba dag gi nang du skye bar 'gyur ba 'di ni /
translated: and having engaged in verbal and mental good conduct, due to that cause and condition, after the body’s destruction, death, and the end of life, one will be born among the hell beings, in the lower realms, in the evil destinies.

original: gnas ma yin no //
analyzed: gnas ma yin no //
translated: This is impossible.

original: 'di ni / gnas yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni / gnas yin te /
translated: This is possible:

original: gang lus kyis legs par spyad pa spyad /
analyzed: gang lus kyis legs par spyad pa spyad /
translated: having engaged in physical good conduct,

original: ngag dang yid kyis legs par spyad pa spyad nas rgyu de dang rkyen des lus zhig nas bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ba 'di ni /
analyzed: ngag dang yid kyis legs par spyad pa spyad nas rgyu de dang rkyen des lus zhig nas bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ba 'di ni /
translated: Having engaged in excellent conduct with speech and mind, by that cause and condition, when the body disintegrates, one will be born in the happy realms, among the gods in the higher worlds.

original: gnas yin no //
analyzed: gnas yin no //
translated: This is possible.

original: gnas ma yin zhing go skabs med pa ni /
analyzed: gnas ma yin zhing go skabs med pa ni /
translated: It is impossible and there is no chance

analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gnyis 'jig rten du gang snga phyi med par 'byung ba 'di ni /
translated: that two perfect buddhas will appear in the world at the same time.

original: gnas ma yin te /🔽gang gcig 'byung ba 'di ni /
analyzed: gnas ma yin te / gang gcig 'byung ba 'di ni /
translated: This is impossible.🔽It is possible

original: gnas yin no //
analyzed: gnas yin no //
translated: that one will appear.🔽It is impossible and there is no chance

original: gnas ma yin zhing go skabs med pa ni; 'khor los bsgyur ba gnyis 'jig rten du gang snga phyi med par 'byung ba 'di ni /
analyzed: gnas ma yin zhing go skabs med pa ni; 'khor los bsgyur ba gnyis 'jig rten du gang snga phyi med par 'byung ba 'di ni /
translated: that two universal monarchs will appear in the world at the same time.

original: gnas ma yin te /
analyzed: gnas ma yin te /
translated: This is impossible.🔽It is possible

original: gang gcig 'byung ba 'di ni /🔽gnas yin no //
analyzed: gang gcig 'byung ba 'di ni / gnas yin no //
translated: that one will appear.

original: gnas ma yin zhing go skabs med pa ni /
analyzed: gnas ma yin zhing go skabs med pa ni /
translated: It is impossible and there is no chance🔽that a woman will become a universal monarch, a Śakra, a Brahmā, or a perfectly enlightened one.

original: gang bud med 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal srid dang / brgya byin nyid dang / tshangs pa nyid dang / bdud nyid byed bar 'gyur ba dang / rang byang chub mngon du byed par 'gyur ba dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba 'di ni /
analyzed: gang bud med 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal srid dang / brgya byin nyid dang / tshangs pa nyid dang / bdud nyid byed bar 'gyur ba dang / rang byang chub mngon du byed par 'gyur ba dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba 'di ni /
translated: “It is possible that a woman will become a universal monarch, or Śakra, or Brahmā, or Māra, or a pratyekabuddha, or a perfectly enlightened buddha.”🔽

original: gnas ma yin no //🔽'di ni / gnas yin te /
analyzed: gnas ma yin no // 'di ni / gnas yin te /
translated: It is impossible for a woman to become a universal monarch, Śakra, Brahmā, or Māra, to manifest pratyekabuddha enlightenment, or to manifest unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: skyes pa gang yin pa'o //🔽gnas ma yin zhing go skabs @557b med pa ni /🔽gang lta ba phun sum tshogs pa'i gang zag bsam bzhin du pha dang / ma dang / dgra bcom pa gsod par 'gyur ba dang / dge 'dun gyi dbyen byed par 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa la ngan sems kyis khrag 'byin par 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: skyes pa gang yin pa'o // gnas ma yin zhing go skabs @557b med pa ni / gang lta ba phun sum tshogs pa'i gang zag bsam bzhin du pha dang / ma dang / dgra bcom pa gsod par 'gyur ba dang / dge 'dun gyi dbyen byed par 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa la ngan sems kyis khrag 'byin par 'gyur ba ni /
translated: It is possible for a man to do all of those.

original: gnas ma yin no //🔽'di ni / gnas yin te /
analyzed: gnas ma yin no // 'di ni / gnas yin te /
translated: It is impossible for a person who has attained the right view to intentionally kill their mother, kill their father, kill an arhat, break up the community, or with an evil mind draw blood from a tathāgata.

original: so so'i skye bo gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is possible for an ordinary person to do all of those.

original: gnas ma yin zhing go skabs med pa ni /
analyzed: gnas ma yin zhing go skabs med pa ni /
translated: It is impossible and there is no chance that

original: gang lta ba phun sum tshogs pa'i gang zag bsam bzhin du srog chags kyi srog gcod par 'gyur ba dang / bslab pa btang nas nyams pa la 'jug par 'gyur ba dang / 'di las phyi rol pa gzhan dag la yon gnas su tshol bar 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: gang lta ba phun sum tshogs pa'i gang zag bsam bzhin du srog chags kyi srog gcod par 'gyur ba dang / bslab pa btang nas nyams pa la 'jug par 'gyur ba dang / 'di las phyi rol pa gzhan dag la yon gnas su tshol bar 'gyur ba dang /
translated: a person who has perfect view would intentionally kill a living being, or that they would give up their training and engage in degeneration, or that they would seek to be a recipient of offerings from others who are outside this doctrine,

original: 'di las phyi rol pa gzhan dag la ston par lta bar 'gyur ba dang / dge mtshan dang / bkra shis dag gis dag par yid ches par 'gyur ba dang / dge sbyong dang bram ze shes pa dang ldan pa de dag shes par bya ba shes shing blta bar bya ba mthong ngo snyam nas dge sbyong dang bram ze gzhan dag gi ngor rtog cing ngor lta bar 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: 'di las phyi rol pa gzhan dag la ston par lta bar 'gyur ba dang / dge mtshan dang / bkra shis dag gis dag par yid ches par 'gyur ba dang / dge sbyong dang bram ze shes pa dang ldan pa de dag shes par bya ba shes shing blta bar bya ba mthong ngo snyam nas dge sbyong dang bram ze gzhan dag gi ngor rtog cing ngor lta bar 'gyur ba dang /
translated: or that they would view others who are outside this doctrine as teachers, or that they would believe in purification through auspicious signs and good fortune, or that they would think, “These śramaṇas and brahmins know what is to be known and see what is to be seen,” and thus look to and look at other śramaṇas and brahmins,

original: srid pa brgyad pa mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba 'di ni /
analyzed: srid pa brgyad pa mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba 'di ni /
translated: or that they would establish an eighth existence.

original: gnas ma yin no //
analyzed: gnas ma yin no //
translated: This is impossible.

original: 'di ni / gnas yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni / gnas yin te /
translated: This is possible.

original: so so'i skye bo gang yin pa'o //🔽gnas ma yin zhing go skabs med pa ni /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo gang yin pa'o // gnas ma yin zhing go skabs med pa ni /
translated: It is the state of an ordinary person.

original: sems kun nas nyon mongs par byed pa dang / shes rab nyam chung bar byed pa dang / rgud pa'i phyogs su gyur pa dang / mya ngan las 'da' bar mi 'gyur ba sgrib pa lnga po ma spangs pa ni /🔽dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang sems shin tu @558a *//
analyzed: sems kun nas nyon mongs par byed pa dang / shes rab nyam chung bar byed pa dang / rgud pa'i phyogs su gyur pa dang / mya ngan las 'da' bar mi 'gyur ba sgrib pa lnga po ma spangs pa ni / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang sems shin tu @558a *//
translated: It is not possible for those who have not abandoned the five hindrances, which cause the mind to be afflicted, weaken insight, lead to decline, and prevent the attainment of nirvāṇa,

original: nye bar bzhag nas gnas par 'gyur ba 'di ni /
analyzed: nye bar bzhag nas gnas par 'gyur ba 'di ni /
translated: to dwell with their minds well established in the four establishments of mindfulness.

original: gnas ma yin no //🔽'di ni / gnas yin te /
analyzed: gnas ma yin no // 'di ni / gnas yin te /
translated: This is not possible.

original: sems kun nas nyon mongs par byed pa dang / shes rab nyam chung bar byed pa dang / rgud pa'i phyogs su gyur ba dang / mya ngan las 'da' bar mi 'gyur ba gang sgrib pa lnga po spangs pas ni /
analyzed: sems kun nas nyon mongs par byed pa dang / shes rab nyam chung bar byed pa dang / rgud pa'i phyogs su gyur ba dang / mya ngan las 'da' bar mi 'gyur ba gang sgrib pa lnga po spangs pas ni /
translated: It is possible for those who have abandoned the five hindrances, which cause the mind to be afflicted, weaken insight, lead to decline, and prevent the attainment of nirvāṇa,

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dag la sems shin tu nye bar bzhag nas gnas par 'gyur ba 'di ni /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dag la sems shin tu nye bar bzhag nas gnas par 'gyur ba 'di ni /
translated: to dwell with their minds well established in the four establishments of mindfulness.

original: gnas yin no //
analyzed: gnas yin no //
translated: This is possible.

original: gnas ma yin zhing go skabs med pa ni /
analyzed: gnas ma yin zhing go skabs med pa ni /
translated: It is impossible and there is no chance that

original: sems kun nas nyon mongs par byed pa dang / shes rab nyam chung bar byed pa dang / rgud pa'i phyogs su gyur pa dang / mya ngan las 'da' bar mi 'gyur ba gang sgrib pa lnga po ma spangs pas ni /
analyzed: sems kun nas nyon mongs par byed pa dang / shes rab nyam chung bar byed pa dang / rgud pa'i phyogs su gyur pa dang / mya ngan las 'da' bar mi 'gyur ba gang sgrib pa lnga po ma spangs pas ni /
translated: those who have not abandoned the five hindrances—which cause the mind to be afflicted, weaken insight, lead to decline, and prevent the attainment of nirvāṇa—

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dag la sems shin tu nye bar bzhag pa na byang chub kyi yan lag bdun sgom pa 'di ni /🔽gnas ma yin no //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dag la sems shin tu nye bar bzhag pa na byang chub kyi yan lag bdun sgom pa 'di ni / gnas ma yin no //
translated: will cultivate the seven factors of awakening while their minds are well established in the four establishments of mindfulness.🔽This is impossible.

original: 'di ni / gnas yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni / gnas yin te /
translated: But it is possible that

original: sems kun nas nyon mongs par byed pa dang / shes rab nyam chung bar byed pa dang / rgud pa'i phyogs su gyur pa dang / mya ngan las 'das par mi 'gyur ba gang sgrib pa lnga po spangs pas ni /
analyzed: sems kun nas nyon mongs par byed pa dang / shes rab nyam chung bar byed pa dang / rgud pa'i phyogs su gyur pa dang / mya ngan las 'das par mi 'gyur ba gang sgrib pa lnga po spangs pas ni /
translated: those who have abandoned the five hindrances—which cause the mind to be afflicted, weaken insight, lead to decline, and prevent the attainment of nirvāṇa—

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dag la sems shin tu nye bar bzhag nas gnas pa na byang chub kyi yan lag bdun sgom par 'gyur ba 'di ni /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dag la sems shin tu nye bar bzhag nas gnas pa na byang chub kyi yan lag bdun sgom par 'gyur ba 'di ni /
translated: will cultivate the seven factors of awakening while their minds are well established in the four establishments of mindfulness.

original: gnas yin no //
analyzed: gnas yin no //
translated: It is possible.

original: gnas ma yin zhing go skabs med pa ni /
analyzed: gnas ma yin zhing go skabs med pa ni /
translated: It is impossible and there is no chance

original: sems kun nas nyon mongs par byed pa dang / shes rab nyam chung byed pa dang / rgud pa'i phyogs su gyur @558b pa dang / mya ngan las 'da' bar mi 'gyur ba gang sgrib pa lnga po ma spangs pas ni /
analyzed: sems kun nas nyon mongs par byed pa dang / shes rab nyam chung byed pa dang / rgud pa'i phyogs su gyur @558b pa dang / mya ngan las 'da' bar mi 'gyur ba gang sgrib pa lnga po ma spangs pas ni /
translated: that those who have not abandoned the five obscurations, which cause the mind to be afflicted, weaken insight, lead to decline, and prevent the attainment of nirvāṇa,

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dag la sems shin tu nye bar bzhag pas gnas pa na byang chub kyi yan lag bdun bsgoms te rang byang chub mngon du byed par 'gyur ba dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba 'di ni /🔽gnas ma yin no //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dag la sems shin tu nye bar bzhag pas gnas pa na byang chub kyi yan lag bdun bsgoms te rang byang chub mngon du byed par 'gyur ba dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba 'di ni / gnas ma yin no //
translated: will, by settling their minds well in the four establishments of mindfulness, cultivate the seven factors of awakening and actualize the state of a solitary buddha, or fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood.🔽This is impossible.

original: 'di ni gnas yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni gnas yin te /
translated: This is possible.

original: sems can kun nas nyon mongs par byed pa dang / shes rab nyam chung bar byed pa dang / rgud pa'i phyogs su gyur pa dang / mya ngan las 'da' par mi 'gyur ba gang sgrib pa lnga po spangs nas ni /
analyzed: sems can kun nas nyon mongs par byed pa dang / shes rab nyam chung bar byed pa dang / rgud pa'i phyogs su gyur pa dang / mya ngan las 'da' par mi 'gyur ba gang sgrib pa lnga po spangs nas ni /
translated: They will abandon the five obscurations that afflict sentient beings, weaken their insight, lead them to misfortune, and prevent them from attaining nirvāṇa.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dag la sems shin tu nye bar bzhag nas gnas pa na byang chub kyi yan lag bdun bsgoms te rang byang chub mngon du byed par 'gyur ba dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba 'di ni /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dag la sems shin tu nye bar bzhag nas gnas pa na byang chub kyi yan lag bdun bsgoms te rang byang chub mngon du byed par 'gyur ba dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba 'di ni /
translated: They will then abide with their minds well-settled in the four establishments of mindfulness, cultivate the seven factors of awakening, and actualize the awakening of a solitary buddha or fully awaken to unsurpassed and perfect buddhahood.

original: gnas te / kun dga' bo /
analyzed: gnas te / kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

original: de tsam gyis na mkhas pa gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la mkhas pa yin no //
analyzed: de tsam gyis na mkhas pa gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la mkhas pa yin no //
translated: this is how the wise become skilled in what is possible and impossible.

original: btsun pa / chos kyi rnam grangs 'di'i ming ci lags /
analyzed: btsun pa / chos kyi rnam grangs 'di'i ming ci lags /
translated: “Lord, what is the name of this Dharma discourse?

original: 'di ji ltar gzung bar bgyi /
analyzed: 'di ji ltar gzung bar bgyi /
translated: How should we remember it?”

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: “Ānanda,

original: de'i phyir chos kyi rnam grangs 'di ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir chos kyi rnam grangs 'di ni /
translated: this Dharma discourse is called

original: le'u bzhi pa zhes bya bar yang zungs shig /
analyzed: le'u bzhi pa zhes bya bar yang zungs shig /
translated: Also remember it as The Fourth Chapter.

original: chos kyi me long zhes bya bar yang zungs shig /
analyzed: chos kyi me long zhes bya bar yang zungs shig /
translated: Also remember it as The Mirror of the Dharma.

original: bdud rtsi'i rnga po che zhes bya bar yang zungs shig /
analyzed: bdud rtsi'i rnga po che zhes bya bar yang zungs shig /
translated: Also remember it as The Great Drum of Immortality.

original: khams mang po pa zhes bya bar yang zungs shig /🔽de bas na khams @559a *//
analyzed: khams mang po pa zhes bya bar yang zungs shig / de bas na khams @559a *//
translated: Also remember it as The Many Constituents.

original: mang po zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mang po zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Therefore, the many constituents

original: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di'i tshig bla dvags yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di'i tshig bla dvags yin no //
translated: is a synonym for this Dharma discourse.

original: khams mang po pa zhes bya ba'i mdo rdzogs so //
analyzed: khams mang po pa zhes bya ba'i mdo rdzogs so //
translated: The Sūtra of the Many Constituents is completed.
